document.heading: Parking Enforcement Modernization Technical Correction Emergency Amendment Act of 2026
To amend, on an emergency basis, the Fraudulent Vehicle Tag and Parking Enforcement Modernization Amendment Act of 2024 to amend the subject to appropriations provision.
document.text: BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Parking Enforcement Modernization Technical Correction Emergency Amendment Act of 2026".

codify:marginalia.display: Amended the applicability of D.C. Law 25-325

section.text: Section 401(a) of the Fraudulent Vehicle Tag and Parking Enforcement Modernization Amendment Act of 2024, effective May 2, 2025 (D.C. Law 25-325, 72 DCR 1284), is amended by striking the phrase "Sections 113, 114(b) and 201(c)(2) shall apply" and inserting the phrase "Section 201(c)(2) shall apply" in its place.
section.codify:annotation: Section 2 of D.C. Act 26-261 amended the applicability provision of section 113 of D.C. Law 25-325 that impacted this section. Therefore the creation of this section by §113 of Law 25-325 has been implemented.

Section 2 of D.C. Act 26-261 amended the applicability provision of section 114(b) of D.C. Law 25-325 that impacted this section. Therefore the amendment to this section by §114(b) of Law 25-325 has been implemented.

section.heading: Fiscal impact statement.
section.text: The Council adopts the fiscal impact statement of the Budget Director as the fiscal impact statement required by section 4a of the General Legislative Procedures Act of 1975, approved October 16, 2006 (120 Stat. 2038; D.C. Official Code § 1-301.47a).

section.heading: Effective date.
section.text: This act shall take effect following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council to override the veto), and shall remain in effect for no longer than 90 days, as provided for emergency acts of the Council of the District of Columbia in section 412(a) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 788; D.C. Official Code § 1-204.12(a)).
